document_data.mainbody:
A snuffing bell, or candle snuffer, was a tool designed for snuffing out candles.
The name of this tool derived from the fact that the part placed upon candles to douse them resembled a bell. They sometimes had rods that measured  in length and weighed . Some held an oiled wick at their tip, for use in lighting candles, oil, or other flammables.
Snuffing bells were only suitable for putting out the flame of a candle, nothing larger, and generally could not douse flames that were magical in nature, unless otherwise noted. For example, the magical candles of Istishian mystics could be doused with a snuffer.
* Auroras Whole Realms Catalogue sold a long-rod variant of snuffing bell in their "Priests Alcove" section, large enough to snuff out even the largest of altar candles and holding an oiled wick at its tip. Uniquely, between the bell and wick there was a blade, allowing for the tool to be used as a weapon.
